events.name: Digital Tech Exchange - Day 1 - Transformation Tools
events.description: Jointly organised by IASA Singapore & IPV6 Forum, and supported by Project Management Association Singapore, this daily exchange covers the themes of Digital Transformation Tools, Trends and Tactics. Leverage on the different platforms that companies can adopt to begin their transformation journey. Find out about shifts in digital transformation in the market, specifically in the Asian Pacific region and discover the various tips and tricks companies can practise to stay ahead of competition. 12pm – 12.45pmBusiness Analysis and Digital TransformationArena Ang (Director / Principal Consultant, EPM International) 12.45pm – 1.30pmDelivering great customer experience through digital engagementStanley Ng (Product Innovation & Business Digitalisation Consultant Head of ASEAN, Sellution) 1.30pm – 2.15pmTransform Faster with the “#1 EA Platform”Michiel Jorna (Director, Solution Director (SD) BITT, Asia Pacific Japan, Software AG) https://www.nxtasiaexpo.com/the-exhibition/activities-partner-events/dx-tech-exchange//
events.location: Marina Bay Sands Convention Centre, Level 5,  10 Bayfront Ave, Singapore

events.name: Learning Innovation Challenge: Pre-Challenge Workshop
events.description:
Note: If you are a CSC staff member, please register for the Internal  Pre-Challenge Workshop @ CSC (22 June), organised especially for staff members. 

At the Pre-Challenge Workshop (26 June) for the Learning Innovation Challenge powered by Civil Service College, we will discuss how we can help public servants embrace a new mindset that celebrates the opportunities within the Future of Learning, to meet their needs and their aspirations.
We will be joined by experts who will share their perspectives on the Future of Learning and shed light on the evolution of learning in a landscape of emerging technologies. You will also find out what you can expect at the Learning Innovation Challenge weekend, and meet fellow learners with whom to form teams for the Challenge.

Challenges
The way we learn is continually evolving, as new technologies enable exciting new ways of learning, and the requirements of learners and their organisations expand to match them. 
What we have to be mindful of, is the “why” of learning. We will need to strike a balance between the learner’s intrinsic motivation based in joy of learning, and the external factors of necessity. We need a more agile, blended approach enabled by technology to harness the power of internal motivation and curiosity - an approach that will fuse learning to work with working to learn.
The Civil Service College plays a key role in preparing Singapore’s Public Service to be ready to take on increasingly complex challenges of this world. Hence, as it shapes the learning culture of the Public Service, the College looks to continue transformation of how it delivers and enables learning, by seeking solutions to the following challenges:
Understanding what Learners need or want:


How might we better assess workplace learning needs for individual Learners?


How might we better design learning interventions and content by engaging with Learners and collecting and utilising data on their learning?


Learning as an “omni-channel” experience:


How might we use new technologies to create refreshing, engaging learning experiences?


How might we provide a “sandbox” for people to tackle their own business challenges and later, transfer their skills and knowledge to the workplace?


Extending beyond the programme:



How might we enable continued peer-to-peer learning and foster learning communities across the whole of Government?


Learn more about the challenges here.

Also, don’t forget to check out the Learning Innovation Challenge (30 June - 1 July), where you can collaborate with innovators from different backgrounds and together create solutions that will help public servants make the most of the Future of Learning!
If you have any questions, please send us an email at hello@upsingapore.com. Thanks!
events.location: LEVEL3, Mapletree Business City, 20 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-22/24, Singapore 117439

events.name: New Tech and Energy Companies of the Future
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/new-tech-and-energy-companies-future New Tech and Energy Companies of the Future Presented by EnRupt and SGInnovate The session will focus on the intersection of new tech and energy companies of the future, which will be distributed and running on a digital backbone. We will discuss what are the different technology solutions and what are the capabilities they bring and how they will change the business models. Date: 26 June 2018Time: 6:30pm – 8:30pmVenue: 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 Programme:6:30pm – 7:00pm: Registration7:00pm – 8:00pm: Panel discussion on Tech and Energy Companies of the Future8:00pm – 8:30pm: Q&A and End Speakers:- Taras Wankewycz, Founder, CEO at H3 Dynamics Holdings, Executive Director at HES Energy Systems, HUS Unmanned Systems and H3 Zoom - David Coldrey, VP, Industries and Digital Leadership, CoE for Energy and Natural Resources in Asia Pacific Japan, SAP Asia Moderator: Katarina Uherova Hasbani, Founder, Enrupt

events.name: AWS Hackdays | Special Edition Machine Learning
events.description: [AWS Hackdays | Special Edition Machine Learning] Let's Build Tomorrow's World with Machine Learning and AWS! This year's edition of the competition is centered around four key industries going through a deep transformation in South East Asia:#Transportation #Media_Entertainment #eCommerce #FinTech The 12-hour hackathons will take place in Singapore on 27 June. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=caw32Gt46jY Learn More and register today (Deadline: 22 June) https://aws.agorize.com/en/challenges/singapore/?t=8QEsFg4ugvPUHt0RYPnDrg
